snippet: The cost of corruption in Afghanistan rose sharply last year to $3.9 billion, with 50 percent of the adult population paying at least one bribe to a public official according to the United Nations.
abstract: Survey by United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime and Afghanistan’s anticorruption unit finds that 50 percent of adult population had to pay at least one bribe to public official in 2012, 9 percent drop from 2009, but total cost of bribes paid to public officials increased 40 percent to $3.9 billion.
lead_paragraph: The cost of corruption in Afghanistan rose sharply last year to $3.9 billion, with 50 percent of the adult population paying at least one bribe to a public official according to the United Nations.

headline.main: Bribes Increase in Afghanistan, U.N. Says
